column2: MISSOURI DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Missouri
column6: MO

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 2. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 3. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column6: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column8: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column10: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.

column2: 4. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column6: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column8: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column10: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.

column2: 5. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge right.
column6: traffic must merge left.
column8: the pavement ends.
column10: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 6. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: turn left into the one-way road.
column10: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

column2: 7. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: look for a human flagger.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
column4: Cell phone shop ahead
column6: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Emergency line available

column2: 9. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 10. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 11. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 12. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 13. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: Tranquilizers.
column6: Marijuana.
column8: A cold remedy.

column2: 14. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 15. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: direct drivers to services.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 16. If you are at fault in a traffic crash and do not pay for the damages:
column4: you must obtain a crash prevention certificate from the DMV before you can drive again.
column6: your driver license or plates or both will be suspended for one year.
column8: you will be sentenced to 3 years in jail.

column2: 17. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: larger and deeper
column6: darker
column8: narrower and shorter

column2: 18. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column6: Never.
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 19. This sign is a:
column4: stop sign.
column6: guide sign.
column8: warning sign.

column2: 20. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column4: travelling on HOV lanes.
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
column8: heavy traffic.

column2: 21. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 22. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 23. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 24. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: Speeding is not allowed
column6: Traffic signals ahead
column8: You must stop ahead
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead
